```{r read in data, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
# packages ####
library(tidyverse)
library(haven)
library(janitor)
#### read in data 
# set data working directory ####
data <- "//rdsfcifs.acrc.bris.ac.uk/MRC-IEU-research/projects/wt1/wp3/037/working/data/"

# open datasets ####
df_age7 <- readRDS(paste0(data, "df_age7.rds"))
df_age9 <- readRDS(paste0(data, "df_age9.rds"))
df_age15 <- readRDS(paste0(data, "df_age15.rds"))
df_age18 <- readRDS(paste0(data, "df_age18.rds"))
df_age24 <- readRDS(paste0(data, "df_age24.rds"))
```

## Age 7
# Exposures

```{r age 7 exposures}
ggplot(df_age_7, aes(x=pm25_age7_std)) + geom_histogram()

ggplot(df_age_7, aes(x=bc_age7_std)) + geom_histogram()

ggplot(df_age_7, aes(x=no2_age7_std)) + geom_histogram()
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
